items.title: DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT DAIMA: Adventure Through the Demon Realm - A Deep Dive
items.summary: DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT, the action RPG developed by CyberConnect2 and published by Bandai Namco Entertainment, has captivated fans by…
items.content_html:
DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT, the action RPG developed by CyberConnect2 and published by Bandai Namco Entertainment, has captivated fans by allowing them to relive the iconic story of Goku and the Z-Fighters. Known for its epic battles, faithful recreation of the anime's storyline, and engaging gameplay, DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT has sold over 8 million copies. Now, the game is expanding its universe with a brand-new DLC pack: "DAIMA: Adventure Through the Demon Realm." This DLC ties directly into the recent Dragon Ball Daima anime series, offering players a chance to experience a fresh, exciting adventure with a unique twist – a miniature Goku.

This article provides a detailed overview about everything we currently know of the New DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT DAIMA DLC, while drawing parallels to the Dragon Ball Daima Anime and answering a few burning questions in regards to the entire saga.

The Premise: A Journey into the Demon Realm

The "DAIMA: Adventure Through the Demon Realm" DLC plunges players into the storyline of Dragon Ball Daima. The core concept of Daima revolves around a mysterious conspiracy that results in Goku and his friends being transformed into children. This transformation weakens them considerably, setting the stage for a new kind of challenge. To undo this curse, Goku and his companions must journey to a new world: the Demon Realm.

The DLC promises to faithfully recreate the "Third Demon Realm," as depicted in the Dragon Ball Daima anime. This includes iconic landscapes with features like "floating islands and mysterious Skyseed plants." Players will explore these intricate environments, encountering new allies and enemies, while navigating the challenges of this mysterious world.

Gameplay: New Mechanics and a Nostalgic Twist

The Kakarot Daima DLC doesn't just offer a new story; it introduces fresh gameplay mechanics that reflect the unique circumstances of the Daima narrative:

  • Goku (Mini) and the Power Pole: Players will primarily control Goku in his miniature form, referred to as "Goku (Mini)." This smaller stature necessitates a change in combat style. Embracing the nostalgia of early Dragon Ball, Goku (Mini) will utilize the Power Pole (Nyoibo) in battle, a weapon not prominently featured in Dragon Ball Z.
  • New Techniques and Support Characters:. "Players can also expect a new battle experience thanks to the introduction of elements unique to the DLC such as the Power Pole or the new form of Goku (mini) Super Saiyan." Also the DLC, leveraging Goku's allies in creative ways. Characters like Glorio, Shin, and Panzy provide support, utilizing support skills that enchance your skills through support and strategic combat advantages.
  • Z Combos: Goku’s Friends provide supporting attacks, and the combined power of the team create devistating Z Combo Finishing Attacks.

Super Saiyan Transformation

Despite his reduced size, Goku (Mini) retains the ability to transform into a Super Saiyan, adding a powerful dimension to the combat encounters.

Story Details and Characters: Echoes of Daima

The DLC is designed to mirror the *Dragon Ball Daima* anime's plot. Here's a breakdown of what players can expect:

  • A Two-Part Adventure: The story is a direct adaptation of the anime series, in the game, *Dragon Ball Daima*. The DLC story will follow the "DAIMA story."
  • The Third Demon Realm: Players will get to explore a whole new world for them to traverse in. A recreation of the Third Demon Realm featured in the Anime, the new maps will host various regions including; floating Islands and skyseed plants.
  • New Companions: Players will relive iconic moments from the perspective of Goku (Mini) through his many advantures, accompained by allies like Glorio, Shin, and Panzy.
  • Reliving Iconic Adventures: The DLC story mode adapts moments directly from the series.

Release Date and Availability

The "DAIMA: Adventure Through the Demon Realm" DLC is being released in a phased approach:

  • Part 1: Is scheduled to launch between July and September 2025 (Summer 2025).
  • Part 2: Will follow, with a release window of between January and March 2026.
  • Bonus Pack: It released on February 27 and Included Consumable itmes for those purchased the DLC as a Season Pass, including:
    • Ultimate Meat Feast
    • Mega Sacred Water
    • Purple Dino Horn
    • Awakening Water

DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT is currently available on a wide range of platforms, ensuring broad accessibility for the DLC:

  • PlayStation 5
  • PlayStation 4
  • Xbox Series X/S
  • Xbox One
  • Nintendo Switch
  • PC (via Steam)

Dragon Ball Daima: The Anime Connection

To fully appreciate the DLC, it's essential to understand its source material, Dragon Ball Daima. Daima is an anime series that bridges the gap between the end of Dragon Ball Z (after the defeat of Kid Buu) and the beginning of Dragon Ball Super.

Here's a quick recap of Daima Story as Described by Creator:

"Hello. I'm Akira Toriyama. I'm currently working on a new Dragon Ball. The Title is “Dragon Ball DAIMA”. “DAIMA” is a made-up term, which in Japanese characters would be “大魔” or in English would be something like “Evil.” Due to a conspiracy, Goku and his friends are turned small. In order to fix things, they'll head off to a new world! It's a grand adventure with intense action in an unknown and mysterious world. Since Goku has to make up for his petite size, he uses his Nyoibo (Power Pole) to fight, something not seen in a long time. I came up with the story and settings, as well as a lot of the designs.

The Story Starts where Goku and company were peacefully when, were suddenly attacked, and turned to into children as a resut of the assult, in which a Demon Realm King set in Motion.. With their Power reduced Goku and Z fighters Travel to Demon World, hoping to return back to Normal by Finding a solution that will restore everyone. Players Explore Third Demon Realm, which include, The Floating Islands, and The Skyseed Plants. The Game also Introduces Players to Three new Allies in Goku's Adventures, Shin, Panzy, Glorio.

CyberConnect2: The Masters of Anime Adaptations

The developer behind *DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT*, CyberConnect2, has a long and respected history of creating high-quality anime-based video games. Their expertise extends beyond the *Dragon Ball* universe and includes titles such as:

  • The .hack series
  • Little Tail Bronx series
  • Naruto: Ultimate Ninja Storm series
  • JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: All Star Battle
  • JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Eyes of Heaven
  • Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Hinokami Chronicles
  • Fuga: Melodies of Steel series

This impressive track record demonstrates CyberConnect2's ability to faithfully translate the essence of beloved anime series into engaging video game experiences. Their involvement with DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT and this new DLC assures fans of a quality product that respects the source material.

The Future of DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT

The "DAIMA: Adventure Through the Demon Realm" DLC represents a significant expansion of the *DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT* universe. Given the game's success and the ongoing support from Bandai Namco, it's likely that further content could be developed in the future. Dragon Ball is going throug a Revival and we might continue see Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot through Future content packs for years to come.

Conclusion: A Must-Have for Dragon Ball Fans

The "DAIMA: Adventure Through the Demon Realm" DLC for *DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT* offers a compelling combination of a new story, fresh gameplay mechanics, and a faithful adaptation of the *Dragon Ball Daima* anime. Whether you're a longtime *Dragon Ball* fan or a newcomer to the franchise, this DLC promises a thrilling adventure that expands the world of *DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT* in exciting ways. With its phased release starting in Summer 2025, players have ample time to prepare for their journey into the Demon Realm.

items.title: Faulty RTX 5080: Performance Drops and What You Need to Know
items.summary: The launch of Nvidia's RTX 50-series "Blackwell" graphics cards has been marred by a series of unexpected issues, raising concerns…
items.content_html:
The launch of Nvidia's RTX 50-series "Blackwell" graphics cards has been marred by a series of unexpected issues, raising concerns among early adopters. Initial excitement surrounding the new generation has been tempered by reports of instability, black screens, and, most recently, a manufacturing defect resulting in reduced performance due to missing Render Output Units (ROPs). This article delves into the specifics of the RTX 5080 ROP issue, its impact on gaming performance, how to check if your card is affected, and what steps you can take.

The ROP Issue: More Than Just a Minor Defect

Initially, reports surfaced concerning missing ROPs on Nvidia's GeForce RTX 5090 and RTX 5070 Ti GPUs. Nvidia acknowledged the issue, stating that it affected approximately 0.5% of those specific cards and advised affected users to seek replacements from their board manufacturers. However, the problem has since been confirmed to extend to the RTX 5080 as well. [7, 10, 11, 13, 15, 20, 23, 30]

Render Output Units (ROPs) are a crucial component of a GPU's rendering pipeline. They are responsible for the final stages of processing, handling tasks like writing pixels to the frame buffer, anti-aliasing (smoothing edges), and color blending. Having fewer ROPs than the specified amount directly impacts a card's ability to perform these operations efficiently, leading to a measurable performance decrease. [7, 21]

The faulty RTX 5080 cards have been found to have 104 ROPs instead of the advertised 112. This mirrors the issue seen with the RTX 5090 (168 instead of 176) and RTX 5070 Ti (88 instead of 96). In all cases, a single ROP partition, consisting of 8 ROP units, is missing. [1, 9, 11, 25]

Performance Impact: Variable, But Potentially Significant

Nvidia initially claimed that the average performance impact of the missing ROPs would be around 4%. While this might hold true as an overall average, independent testing by Gamers Nexus has revealed that the performance hit can be significantly higher in certain games, particularly at higher resolutions. [2, 4, 5, 8, 21]

Gamers Nexus, after putting out a bounty for a defective RTX 5080, acquired a Founders Edition model with the ROP deficiency and conducted a series of benchmark tests. [2] The results demonstrate a clear and, in some cases, considerable performance delta between a fully functional RTX 5080 and the faulty unit.

Key Findings from Gamers Nexus Testing:

  • Up to 11% performance loss in *Total War: Warhammer III* at 4K resolution. [2, 4, 5, 8]
  • 8.7% performance drop in *Dying Light 2* at 4K. This decreased to 8.8% at 1440p. [2, 4]
  • 4.9% performance difference in *Dragon's Dogma 2* at 4K. [4]
  • Minimal to no performance difference in games like *Baldur's Gate 3* and *Black Myth: Wukong*. [4]
  • In a synthetic benchmark (3DMark Time Spy), the faulty RTX 5080 scored 12% lower than a normal unit, even potentially falling behind the RTX 4080 Super in some scenarios. [2, 23]

The data clearly indicates that the impact of the missing ROPs is highly game-dependent. Games that are more heavily reliant on ROP-intensive operations, especially at higher resolutions, are more likely to exhibit a noticeable performance reduction. [2, 4]

At 1440p, the performance gap tends to be smaller, with most games falling within the 3-4% range, according to Gamers Nexus. However, even at this resolution, *Dying Light 2* still showed a substantial 8.8% difference. This suggests that the performance penalty may become more pronounced as resolutions increase, further stressing the limited ROP resources. [2, 4]

The original release date of the RTX 5080 was January 30, 2025. [3, 29] The initial MSRP was listed as $1,000. [3]

How ROPs Function, in More Detail

ROPs (Render Output Units) are crucial, specialized hardware units within a GPU that are involved with the concluding steps in transforming 3D scene information into the 2D image that is shown on a screen. Their responsibilities include:

  • Pixel Operations and Framebuffer Writes ROPs will perform a set of pixel operations, involving actions such as blending colors, executing depth checks to resolve which pixels are seen or hidden, and putting the pixels, ready to be displayed, to the buffer, awaiting them to be transmitted.
  • Multisampling Anti-Aliasing (MSAA): ROPs do this to remove the jagginess of edges, improving picture clarity by having sample several points within a single pixel. These calculations result in a smoother concluding image.
  • Memory Access: These steps write directly the frame buffer to the memory, therefore effective operations directly will dictate the card's maximum effective frame rate.

Other Blackwell Launch Issues

The ROP problem isn't the only issue to plague the RTX 50-series launch. Users have reported a range of other problems, including:

  • Black screen issues and system crashes (BSODs): These have been linked to driver instability, with Nvidia releasing driver updates (version 572.60) and vBIOS updates to address the problem. [12, 16, 17, 19] Some users have found temporary workarounds by using HDMI instead of DisplayPort or even lowering their monitor's refresh rate. [16]
  • DisplayPort connectivity issues: Some users have reported problems specifically when using DisplayPort connections, with some suggesting that HDMI 2.1 might offer a more stable experience. [16]
  • Potential PCI Express 5.0 compatibility problems: Some reports indicate stability issues when using PCIe 5.0 on certain motherboards, with downgrading to PCIe 4.0 in the BIOS sometimes providing a temporary solution. [27]

Nvidia's Response and Recommended Actions

Nvidia has officially acknowledged the ROP issue, initially stating that it affected a small percentage (0.5%) of RTX 5090, RTX 5090D, and RTX 5070 Ti GPUs. They later amended this statement to include the RTX 5080. [7, 11, 13, 15, 30] Their current statement reads:

"We have identified a rare issue affecting less than 0.5% (half a percent) of GeForce RTX 5090 / 5090D, RTX 5080, and 5070 Ti GPUs which have one fewer ROP than specified. The average graphical performance impact is 4%, with no impact on AI and Compute workloads. Affected consumers can contact the board manufacturer for a replacement. The production anomaly has been corrected." [1, 11, 30]

Nvidia GeForce Global PR director Ben Berraondo stated, "Upon further investigation, we've identified that an early production build of GeForce RTX 5080 GPUs were also affected by the same issue. Affected consumers can contact the board manufacturer for a replacement." [11, 13, 15, 30]

Nvidia places the responsibility on users to check their cards and initiate the replacement process with the board manufacturer (AIB), such as ASUS, MSI, Gigabyte, Zotac, etc. This has caused frustration among some users, especially given the difficulty and expense of acquiring these high-end cards in the first place. [5, 30]

The Zotac RTX 5080 Solid, as an example of an AIB card, has generally performed about 3-6% better in tests than the Founders Edition, however, was priced about $270-$300 more than the Founders Edition. [29]

How to Check Your RTX 50-Series Card

If you own an RTX 5090, RTX 5080, or RTX 5070 Ti, it is strongly recommended that you check your card's ROP count. The easiest way to do this is using the free utility GPU-Z from TechPowerUp. [7, 14, 25, 26]

Steps:

  1. Download and install GPU-Z from a reputable source (e.g., TechPowerUp's website).
  2. Run GPU-Z.
  3. Look for the "ROPs/TMUs" field on the main "Graphics Card" tab.
  4. Compare the number on the left (ROP count) to the expected value for your card:
    • RTX 5090: 176 ROPs [9, 14]
    • RTX 5080: 112 ROPs [9, 14]
    • RTX 5070 Ti: 96 ROPs [9]
  5. If your ROP count is lower than the expected value (168 for the 5090, 104 for the 5080, or 88 for the 5070 Ti), your card is affected and you should contact your board manufacturer for a replacement. [14, 25]

What to Do if Your Card is Affected

If you discover that your RTX 50-series card has the reduced ROP count, your primary course of action is to contact the board manufacturer (the company that made your specific card, like ASUS, Gigabyte, MSI, Zotac, etc.) and request a replacement. [1, 7, 11, 13, 15, 30] Nvidia directs affected consumers to do this, rather than handling the replacements directly. [30]

It's important to do this as soon as possible. If you are still within the return window for your purchase, returning the card to the retailer may be faster and easier than going through the manufacturer's RMA (Return Merchandise Authorization) process. [5]

Be prepared for potential delays. Given the limited availability of RTX 50-series cards, getting a replacement could take some time. [8]

Looking Ahead

While it remains uncertain, there is an expectation among certain tech analysis entities that upcoming GPU generations, notably Series 60 (anticipated to adopt 3nm process technology), could be a significant step-up from the Series 50 GPUs.

Conclusion

The ROP issue with the RTX 5080, along with other problems affecting the RTX 50-series launch, is a disappointing development for consumers who invested in Nvidia's latest generation of graphics cards. The variable performance impact, the need for users to self-diagnose, and the potential wait times for replacements all contribute to a less-than-ideal experience.

While Nvidia has acknowledged the problem and offered replacements through board manufacturers, the situation highlights the importance of thorough quality control and transparent communication, particularly in the high-end hardware market. It also emphasizes the value of independent testing and reporting by outlets like Gamers Nexus in uncovering and quantifying such issues.

If you're a Blackwell owner, check your card, and if necessary, start the replacement process. Hopefully, Nvidia and its partners will resolve these production issues swiftly and ensure that future batches of RTX 50-series cards deliver the full performance potential that customers expect.

items.title: Best iPhone Music Players 2025: A Comprehensive Guide
items.summary: The iPhone's built-in Music app provides basic functionality for playing music, but a vibrant ecosystem of third-party music player apps…
items.content_html:
The iPhone's built-in Music app provides basic functionality for playing music, but a vibrant ecosystem of third-party music player apps exists to elevate your listening experience. These apps offer enhanced features, superior sound quality customization, support for a wider variety of file formats, and integration with various online services. This article will explore some of the best iPhone music players available in 2025, catering to diverse needs and preferences, from casual listeners to audiophiles.

Why Choose a Third-Party Music Player?

While the default iPhone Music app is adequate for basic playback, third-party apps often provide:

  • Expanded Format Support: Many third-party players support lossless audio formats like FLAC, ALAC, WAV, and APE, which the default app doesn't handle natively. This is crucial for users with high-fidelity music libraries.
  • Advanced Equalization and Sound Customization: Third-party apps frequently offer more sophisticated equalizers (often with 10 or more bands), bass boosters, and other sound effects (like reverb, wide stereo, and crossfading) to tailor the audio output to your exact preferences and headphones.
  • Enhanced Library Management: Improved organization features, such as better sorting options, tag editing, and folder-based browsing, make managing large music libraries easier.
  • Cloud Service Integration: Many apps allow you to stream music directly from cloud storage services like Google Drive, Dropbox, OneDrive, and others, freeing up space on your device. Some also integrate with music streaming services beyond Apple Music, such as Spotify and SoundCloud.
  • Offline Playback: Most third-party players allow you to download music from cloud services for offline listening, a crucial feature for times when you don't have an internet connection.
  • Customizable Interface: Some apps offer themes and customizable layouts, allowing you to personalize the app's appearance.
  • Additional Features: Features like sleep timers, gapless playback, lyrics display, and support for technologies like CarPlay, Sonos, AirPlay, and Google Chromecast enhance the overall listening experience.

Top iPhone Music Players in 2025

Here's a detailed look at some of the best iPhone music player apps available:

1. VOX Music Player

VOX is a highly popular and versatile music player known for its broad format support, excellent sound quality, and integration with various music sources. It's a strong contender for the best overall music player for many users.

Key Features:

  • Wide Format Support: Plays virtually all popular audio formats, including lossless formats like FLAC, ALAC, APE, WAV, and DSD, as well as lossy formats like MP3, WMA, and OGG.
  • High-Quality Audio Engine: Uses a custom-made audio engine (based on BASS™) designed for crisp and clear sound, especially with Hi-Res audio formats.
  • Multiple Music Sources: Access music from your iTunes library, SoundCloud, Spotify, and over 30,000 online radio stations.
  • VOX Premium Cloud: Offers an optional premium subscription with unlimited cloud storage for your music collection, syncing across all your devices (Mac, iPhone, iPad, Windows). It ensures original quality playback without compression.
  • Advanced Audio Features: Includes a parametric equalizer with over 30 presets, bass booster, gapless playback, crossfade, time stretch, tempo adjustment, and support for BS2B (Bauer stereophonic-to-binaural).
  • CarPlay and Sonos Support: Seamlessly integrate with your car's entertainment system and Sonos speakers.
  • Easy Music Management: Offers Wi-Fi music transfer (AirDrop), iTunes file sharing, and playlist management.
  • YouTube Integration: Play any song or playlist from YouTube directly within VOX.

Pros:

  • Exceptional format support.
  • High-quality audio playback.
  • Integration with multiple music services.
  • Optional unlimited cloud storage.
  • Advanced audio customization options.

Cons:

  • Some features require a premium subscription.

2. jetAudio Music Player

jetAudio has a long-standing reputation in the music player world, known for its extensive features and sound enhancement capabilities. It's a great option for users who want a lot of control over their audio experience.

Key Features:

  • Wide Range of Sound Effects: Offers a variety of sound effects, including X-Wide, Reverb, X-Bass, and AGC (Automatic Gain Control) to avoid volume fluctuations.
  • Powerful Equalizer: Features a 10/20-band graphic equalizer with numerous presets (16 in the free version, and more in Plus) for fine-tuning the sound.
  • Playback Speed Control: Adjust playback speed from 50% to 200% (pitch adjusted).
  • Crossfading and Gapless Playback: Provides smooth transitions between tracks.
  • Lyrics Display: Shows lyrics for supported songs.
  • Sleep Timer: Automatically stops playback after a set time.
  • Network Streaming: Stream music from shared folders on a local home network (SMB) or WebDAV servers. It also supports streaming from cloud services like Google Drive, Dropbox, Box, and OneDrive.
  • Media Center: Provides various features through Media Manager, Explorer Window and Device Manger.
  • Media Manager: You can manage all your media files using the Media Manger, which includes CD Library, Media Library, Automatic Browsing, Playlist, and Automatic Playlist.

Pros:

  • Extensive sound enhancement features.
  • Robust equalizer.
  • Supports a wide variety of file formats.
  • Network streaming capabilities.

Cons:

  • The user interface can feel a bit cluttered due to the sheer number of features.
  • Some features require a paid "Plus" version.

3. Flacbox Music Player

Flacbox is an excellent choice for users who prioritize lossless audio quality and have a large music library stored in the cloud. It stands out for its cloud integration and powerful equalizer.

Key Features:

  • High-Resolution Audio Support: Designed for high-quality audio playback, supporting almost any audio file format, including FLAC, ALAC, OPUS, and more.
  • Cloud Music Streaming: Lets you create your own cloud music streaming service by connecting to various cloud storage providers, including Google Drive, Dropbox, OneDrive, Box, MEGA, and more.
  • Offline Playback: Download playlists, albums, artists, or individual tracks for offline listening.
  • Professional Audio Equalizer: Features a 10-band equalizer with iPod-style presets, a preamplifier, and a bass booster.
  • File Management: Includes a built-in file manager for working with your music collection.
  • ID3 Tag Editor: Fix corrupted track metadata.
  • Support for Network Protocols: Supports WebDAV, SMB, and DLNA.
  • AirPlay, SONOS, and Google Chromecast Support: Stream music to compatible devices.
  • Sleep Timer, Shuffle Mode, and Album Covers: Offers standard music player features.

Pros:

  • Excellent support for lossless audio formats.
  • Seamless integration with various cloud storage services.
  • Powerful equalizer and bass booster.
  • Offline playback capabilities.
  • Supports various network protocols and streaming devices.

Cons:

  • Primarily focused on cloud-based music libraries.

4. FLAC Player+ Music Player

FLAC Player+ is a dedicated player for lossless audio formats, particularly FLAC, ALAC, and RAW. It offers a simple and user-friendly interface optimized for iOS.

Key Features:

  • Lossless Audio Support: Specifically designed for FLAC, ALAC, and RAW audio codecs.
  • 10-Band Equalizer: Provides a 10-band equalizer for sound customization.
  • Multiple Themes: Offers five themes: white, dark, blue, green, and purple.
  • 24-bit and 32-bit Audio Support: Handles high-resolution audio output.
  • Library Management: Manage songs by playlist, album, artist, composer, and genre.
  • Embedded Cover Art and Lyrics: Displays embedded artwork and lyrics.
  • Background Audio Playback: Continues playing music even when the app is in the background.
  • Bluetooth Headset Support: Works seamlessly with Bluetooth headphones.
  • File Transfer: Supports iTunes File Sharing, Wi-Fi Transfer, iCloud, and importing from Google Drive.

Pros:

  • Simple and easy to use.
  • Dedicated to lossless audio playback.
  • Offers a 10-band equalizer.
  • Supports high-resolution audio.
  • Multiple file transfer options.

Cons:

  • Limited format support compared to more versatile players like VOX.

5. MPX Music Player

MPX is marketed as a music player and podcast player, emphasizing its equalizer and visual effects. It focuses on providing a customizable and immersive listening experience.

Key Features:

  • Volume Booster and Visual Presets: Enhances audio output and offers visual effects to complement the music.
  • Band Equalizer: Provides a band equalizer for sound customization.
  • Podcast Support: In addition to music, it's also designed for listening to podcasts.
  • Customizable User Interface: Offers various themes to personalize the app's appearance.
  • Intuitive interface The app is user-friendly and easy to use to get the sound quality you desire.

Pros:

  • Focus on audio enhancement and visual effects.
  • Customizable user interface.
  • Suitable for both music and podcasts.

Cons:

  • Less information is available about the specific features and format support compared to other players. It's primarily advertised through its YouTube video and App Store page.

6. Foobar2000

Foobar2000 is a highly customizable and advanced audio player. While it might have a steeper learning curve than other options, it offers extensive control and configuration for power users.

Key Features:

  • Supported Audio Formats: Plays MP3, MP4, AAC, Vorbis, Opus, FLAC, WavPack, WAV, AIFF, and Musepack.
  • Gapless Playback: Offers a smooth listening experience with gapless playback.
  • ReplayGain Support: Provides full ReplayGain support for both playback and scanning.
  • Network Server Support: Supports playback and downloading music from various network servers (UPnP, FTP, WebDAV).
  • Customizable: Foobar2000 allows for high levels of customization.
  • Addons: Can read APE, HDCD, AC3, DTS, SACD, and DVD-Audio formats with addons.

Pros:

  • Wide range of supported formats.
  • Advanced features for audiophiles.
  • High level of customization.

Cons:

  • Can be difficult to navigate at first.
  • Closed source.

Other Notable Music Players

While the above list covers some of the top contenders, several other excellent iPhone music players are worth considering:

  • Music Player X: Focuses on an intuitive UI, a superior equalizer, crossfade transitions, and high-quality sound.
  • Evermusic: A good option for offline music playback, offering easy access to music stored on cloud services without requiring synchronization.
  • Spotify: While primarily a streaming service, Spotify offers excellent offline playback capabilities for premium subscribers.
  • Boom: Boom is another music player for iPhones. Boom features a 16-band customizable equalizer.
  • Music Cloud Offline: Allows you to download songs from cloud storage services and access them offline. It supports iCloud, Dropbox, Google Drive, and more.
  • Equalizer+ HD music player: Equalizer+ HD is an all-in-one music player featuring an equalizer and bass booster.

Conclusion

The best iPhone music player for you depends on your specific needs and priorities. If you value broad format support, high-quality audio, and extensive customization options, VOX and jetAudio are excellent choices. If you have a large library of lossless music stored in the cloud, Flacbox is a standout option. FLAC Player+ offers a simpler, dedicated solution for FLAC files, while MPX focuses on audio enhancement and visual effects. Consider your music library, listening habits, and desired features when making your decision. Any of these players will significantly enhance your iPhone music listening experience beyond what the default Music app provides.

items.title: Galaxy A56 vs. Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus vs. Poco X7 Pro: Mid-Range Smartphone Showdown
items.summary: In the competitive world of smartphones, choosing the best device according to the specific needs of each user can be…
items.content_html:
In the competitive world of smartphones, choosing the best device according to the specific needs of each user can be difficult. The Samsung Galaxy A56, Poco X7 Pro, and Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus are very close in terms of technical specifications, but each has its own unique features that can influence the final choice. In this article, we will examine the strengths and weaknesses of each by comparing all three models in detail to see which is the best mid-range phone for you.

Design and Build

Galaxy A56: With a beautiful design and good build quality, the Galaxy A56 uses Gorilla Glass Victus on the front and back, which increases its resistance to scratches and impacts. In addition, its aluminum frame provides a stylish and modern look in addition to increasing its strength. This phone weighs 197 grams, which is slightly heavier than its competitors.


Back and front panel and color scheme of the Galaxy A56

Poco X7 Pro: The body of the Poco X7 Pro is made of silicone polymer, which is typically less resistant to scratches than glass. The phone comes in two models with weights of 195 grams and 198 grams, but overall it is almost the same weight as the Galaxy A56 and lighter than the Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus. Also, the Poco phone has a wider variety of colors in terms of design, which may be more attractive to some people.

Front and back panel of the Xiaomi Poco X7 Pro

Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus: The front of the Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus is covered with Gorilla Glass Victus 2 and, at 210.8 grams, it is heavier than its competitors. This phone has a high build quality, but its greater weight can be a bit annoying for some users.


Xiaomi Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus Mobile

Display

The Galaxy A56, Poco X7 Pro, and Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus all feature AMOLED displays with a refresh rate of 120Hz, but there are differences in their quality and features.

Galaxy A56: The Galaxy A56 features a 6.7-inch Super AMOLED display with a resolution of 2340 x 1080 pixels. The display supports a maximum brightness of 1200 nits (in HBM mode) and the HDR10 Plus standard, which will perform very well in various lighting conditions. The display also supports Always-on Display, which is a popular and useful feature for many users.


Samsung Galaxy A56 Front and Back Colors

Poco X7 Pro: The Poco X7 Pro has a 6.67-inch display with a resolution of 2712 x 1220 pixels and excellent color accuracy. The display supports HDR10 Plus and Dolby Vision, and offers a maximum brightness of 3200 nits along with 12-bit color depth, which will be a great experience for watching HDR content. The device also has a touch sampling rate of 480 Hz, which provides a high response speed for games and everyday applications.


Front and back panel of the Xiaomi Poco X7 Pro mobile phone

Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus: Like the Poco X7 Pro, the Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus uses a 6.67-inch AMOLED display with a resolution of 2712 x 1220 pixels and supports HDR10 Plus and Dolby Vision standards. This model of the Xiaomi phone has a maximum brightness of 300 nits, which is impressive compared to other phones and makes it easy to watch content in very bright environments.

Overall, the Poco X7 Pro and Redmi Note 14 Pro+ have better displays, at least on paper, thanks to higher brightness, better color accuracy, and support for Dolby Vision and HDR10 Plus. The Galaxy A56 falls behind its competitors in this area, given its higher price.

Performance and Chipset

Galaxy A56: The Galaxy A56 uses the Exynos 1580 chip with a 4nm manufacturing process, which includes 8 processing cores with a maximum frequency of 2.91 GHz. This chip, together with the Xclipse 540 GPU, can provide good performance for everyday tasks, gaming, and multitasking.

Poco X7 Pro: The Poco X7 Pro uses the Dimensity 8400 Ultra chip, which has 8 cores at 3.25 GHz and uses the Mali-G720 MC7 GPU. This chip is specifically designed for better gaming performance and can provide a smooth and lag-free experience in heavy games and applications.

Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus: Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus uses the 3rd generation Snapdragon 7s chip with 8 processing cores. The main cores of this chip operate at a frequency of 2.5 GHz and also use the Adreno 710 graphics processor, which has very good performance. The device seems to be an attractive option especially for mobile gamers.


Xiaomi Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus Mobile

According to the technical specifications, the Poco X7 Pro and Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus are in a higher category than the Galaxy A56 in terms of processing and graphics power. To give you a better idea, let’s take a look at the Geekbench benchmarks for these three phones:

Phone Name Single-core Multi-core
Galaxy A56 1353 3832
Poco X7 Pro 1604 6179
Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus 1158 3158

Cameras

The cameras on the Poco X7 Pro and Redmi Note 14 Pro Plus each have their own unique features that appeal to users with different needs.

The Galaxy A56’s 50-megapixel main camera features autofocus, optical image stabilization (OIS), and a 1/1.56-inch sensor, so it delivers good image quality even in low-light conditions. The 12MP f/2.2 ultrawide camera with a 123-degree field of view and the 5MP f/2.4 macro camera, along with 4K video recording, make this a good choice for everyday photography. However, compared to other competitors, the ultrawide and macro camera capabilities of this device are lacking.

items.title: AMD's Radeon RX 9070 Series: A New Challenger in the Graphics Card Arena
items.summary: The graphics card market is a constant battleground, with AMD and Nvidia vying for dominance. Recently, AMD launched its Radeon…
items.content_html:
The graphics card market is a constant battleground, with AMD and Nvidia vying for dominance. Recently, AMD launched its Radeon RX 9070 and RX 9070 XT graphics cards, based on the new RDNA 4 architecture, and they've immediately made waves. These cards are not only competitively priced but also promise to address the supply issues that have plagued recent Nvidia releases. This article will delve into the details of the RX 9070 series, examining its specifications, performance, pricing, availability, and the broader implications for the GPU market.

The RDNA 4 Architecture: An Evolution, Not a Revolution

AMD's RDNA 4 architecture, powering the RX 9070 series, is best described as an evolution of the previous RDNA 3 architecture, rather than a complete overhaul. Built on TSMC's 4nm process node, the die size of the RX 9070 and 9070 XT is similar to that of the RX 7800 XT (357 mm²), but the transistor count has nearly doubled to 53.9 billion.

While the overall architectural layout appears similar to RDNA 3 at first glance, a closer look at the Compute Units (CUs) reveals key improvements and efficiencies. RDNA 4's CUs feature a dual SIMD32 architecture with enhanced matrix operations. Key features are:

  • 2x 16-bit and 4x 8-bit/4-bit matrix rates.
  • 4:2 structured sparsity for doubled efficiency.
  • New 8-bit float data types.
  • More efficient register management for reduced memory latency.

These improvements lead to enhanced performance in several areas. According to AMD, rasterization performance has improved by approximately 40% over RDNA 3. More significantly, ray tracing performance has essentially doubled, and AI performance (FP16 dense compute) has also doubled compared to the prior gen. The gains in lower-precision formats are touted as being even more substantial. This reflects the industry-wide focus on AI and machine learning, with AMD seemingly aiming to improve their standing in this area.

RDNA 4 retains the chiplet design which had been present in some prior models, which was crucial to enabling higher performance with lower power consumption.

Radeon RX 9070 and RX 9070 XT: Specifications and Features

The Radeon RX 9070 series initially consists of two models: the RX 9070 and the RX 9070 XT. Both cards share several core features:

  • 16GB of GDDR6 memory: This provides ample VRAM for high-resolution gaming and content creation, future-proofing the cards for upcoming titles.
  • 256-bit memory interface: A wide memory bus ensures sufficient bandwidth for the GPU to access the VRAM.
  • 64MB of Infinity Cache: AMD's Infinity Cache technology helps to reduce memory latency and improve overall performance.
  • DisplayPort 2.1a and HDMI 2.1b connectivity: Support for the latest display standards enables high refresh rates and resolutions.
  • PCIe 5.0: Providing highest bandwidth transfer from the graphics cards to the supporting motherboard.
  • Standard 8-pin PCIe power connectors: Unlike Nvidia's shift to the 12VHPWR connector (and subsequent issues), AMD has opted to stick with the familiar and widely compatible 8-pin connectors.

The differences between the two models are summarized in the table below:

Feature RX 9070 RX 9070 XT
Compute Units 56 64
Game Clock 2.1 GHz 2.4 GHz
Boost Clock Up to 2.5 GHz Up to 3.0 GHz
AI Accelerators 112 128
Power Target 220W 304W
Stream Processors 3,584 4,096
ROPs 128 128
Required System Power 650 W 750 W

As seen from the table, the RX 9070 XT features more compute units, higher clock speeds, a larger number of AI accelerators, and, consequently, a higher power target. These specifications can have some differences with reference to the manufacturing partners of AMD, such as Gigabyte, Sapphire, ASUS and others.

It's worth noting that, unlike previous generations, there are no reference designs for these cards from AMD directly. All RX 9070 and 9070 XT cards will be custom designs from board partners. This means that slight variations in performance, cooling, and even power connectors can be expected between different models. Some RX 9070 XTs utilize the newer 12V-2x6 connector while the others use either dual or triple 8-pin connectors.

Performance Expectations: Competing with the Competition

AMD has provided some first-party benchmark results for the RX 9070 series. According to these figures the 9070 XT is averaging around 42% improvement, but independent testing confirms it will often exceed 45%. Here's a summary of AMD's claims:

  • RX 9070 XT vs. RX 7900 GRE (4K, Ultra Settings): 42% faster on average (across 30+ games, including both rasterized and ray-traced titles).
  • RX 9070 vs. RX 7900 GRE (4K, Ultra Settings): 21% faster on average.
  • RX 9070 XT VS RX 6900 XT (4K, Maximum Settings): 51% Faster on average
  • RX 9070 XT vs. RTX 3090 (4K, Max Settings): 26% faster.
  • RX 9070 vs. RTX 3080 (4K, Max Settings): 26% faster.
  • RX 9070 XT vs. Nvidia RTX 5070 Ti (4K): Approximately 2% slower, according to AMD's own testing.

It's important to note that AMD did not directly compare the RX 9070 series to Nvidia's RTX 40-series or, crucially, the recently released RTX 50-series (5070, 5070 Ti, 5080, 5090) in most of their presented benchmarks. Instead, they focused on comparisons to older-generation cards, likely due to the direct pricing competition they are mounting against the RTX 5070 and 5070 Ti. While showing a substantial generational leap is valuable, gamers and consumers will naturally want to see how the new cards stack up against their direct, current-generation competition. However some early metrics compare it with strong gains versus the NVIDIA 30-series GPUs.

Pricing and Availability: A Strong Value Proposition

One of the most compelling aspects of the RX 9070 series is its pricing. AMD has set the MSRPs as follows:

  • Radeon RX 9070: $549 USD
  • Radeon RX 9070 XT: $599 USD

These prices were officially confirmed in a special event held in China. For the Chinese market, prices are 4499 RMB for the RX 9070 and 4999 RMB for the RX 9070 XT. These are MSRP, but they may vary.

This pricing strategy directly undercuts Nvidia's offerings. For example, the RTX 5070 Ti has an official MSRP of $749, making the RX 9070 XT a significantly more affordable option, assuming AMD's performance claims hold true. This puts immense pressure on Nvidia, particularly given the ongoing supply chain issues affecting the RTX 50 series. The RTX 5070 is listed at $549 and with this price AMD will have both cards to compete in this space.

The RX 9070 series officially launched on March 6, 2025. Unlike Nvidia's staggered release strategy for the RTX 50 series, both the RX 9070 and RX 9070 XT were released simultaneously. However some differences were reported regarding price accuracy from the manufacturer recommendations.

Availability and Supply: AMD's Advantage

While pricing is a critical factor, availability is equally crucial in the current GPU market. Nvidia's RTX 50-series launch has been marred by severe supply shortages, leading to inflated prices and widespread frustration among consumers. Reports suggest that these shortages could last for several months, particularly for the higher-end models (RTX 5090 and RTX 5080) but also for the RTX 5070 Ti. The issues seem to be related to the late issuance of finalized BIOSes to board partners, and manufacturing challenges. There was a production anomaly related to 0,5% of the NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5090/5090D and 5070 Ti cards causing missing ROPs in the cards, producing around 4% lower performance in graphics (no impacts to AI and Compute loads). The impacted customers were encouraged to contact the manufacturers to request replacement.

In contrast, AMD has promised "excellent availability" for the RX 9070 series across all markets. One report even suggested that RDNA 4 shipments could be 3-10 times higher than those of the RTX 5080 at launch. The RX9070 series have better availability across the different regions, this has not been the case since pandemic years, especially in comparison with other GPU manufacturer offerings.

While the leaker indicates that there may still not be enough, due to significant pent-up consumer demand, a launch on this scale, AMD could have significant quantities that can sell out quicky due to high market interest.

AMD's strategy of shipping cards to distributors for months prior to the official launch seems to have paid off, allowing them to build up sufficient stock. Pre-orders in China have already shown exceptionally strong demand, with the RX 9070 XT significantly outpacing the non-XT model. This early indication of consumer interest, coupled with AMD's promised availability, suggests that the RX 9070 series may avoid the supply woes that have plagued Nvidia. Out of 1535 initial orders for the Chinese market the breakdown between XT and non-XT models has been reported to be close to 60/40. The 916 orders correspond to the RX 9070 XT, out of the total of 1535 entries. This advantage may allow it to capture some market, especially taking into account the ongoing issues with 50-series GPUs.

FidelityFX Super Resolution (FSR) 4: AMD's Answer to DLSS

Alongside the new hardware, AMD is also introducing FidelityFX Super Resolution (FSR) 4. This is AMD's next-generation upscaling and frame generation technology, designed to compete with Nvidia's Deep Learning Super Sampling (DLSS). FSR 4 is optimized for the new ML hardware inside the RDNA 4 graphics cards and promises to deliver significantly improved image quality compared to previous versions of FSR, which were hardware-agnostic. It features AI Upscaling.

Due to its reliance on RDNA 4's dedicated AI hardware, FSR 4 will initially be exclusive to the RX 9000 series cards at launch. AMD is aiming to have FSR 4 support in 30+ games at launch, with plans to expand to over 75 games by the end of the year.

The Bottom Line: A Promising Launch for AMD

The AMD Radeon RX 9070 and RX 9070 XT represent a significant step forward for AMD in the graphics card market. With competitive pricing, a focus on improved availability, and the introduction of FSR 4, AMD is positioning itself as a strong contender to Nvidia's dominance. The RDNA 4 architecture's enhancements in ray tracing and AI performance, combined with a sensible pricing strategy, make these cards attractive options for gamers and content creators alike. While independent reviews will be crucial in validating AMD's performance claims, the early signs are overwhelmingly positive. If AMD can maintain sufficient supply, the RX 9070 series has the potential to significantly disrupt the GPU landscape and offer consumers a compelling alternative to Nvidia's offerings. The market will watch the battle develop throughout the current year.

items.title: First 3D-Printed Metal Object Made in Space Returns to Earth: A Giant Leap for Space Manufacturing
items.summary: In a groundbreaking achievement for space exploration and manufacturing, the first metal object 3D-printed entirely in space has safely returned…
items.content_html:
In a groundbreaking achievement for space exploration and manufacturing, the first metal object 3D-printed entirely in space has safely returned to Earth. This milestone, spearheaded by the European Space Agency (ESA) aboard the International Space Station (ISS), marks a significant step towards self-sufficiency and opens up exciting possibilities for future long-duration missions and off-world settlements.


The Historic Object: A Symbol of In-Space Manufacturing

The returned object, described as a round metal part with several small cylinders protruding from it, may appear unassuming at first glance. However, its significance lies not in its form, but in its origin. It represents the culmination of a project aimed at developing and testing in-orbit manufacturing technologies. This specific part, along with others printed on the ISS, will serve a crucial purpose: allowing scientists to compare the differences between metal parts manufactured in the microgravity environment of space with those produced under Earth's gravity.

The part is now in the hands of ESA scientists at the European Space and Technology Research Centre (ESTEC) in the Netherlands, where it will undergo extensive qualitative testing and detailed analysis. A second, identical part will soon be sent to the Technical University of Denmark (DTU) for parallel studies. These comparative analyses are essential for understanding how microgravity affects the properties of 3D-printed metal, such as strength, porosity, and overall structural integrity.

The Journey to In-Space Metal 3D Printing

The achievement of 3D printing metal in space was not a sudden leap but the result of years of research and development. The process began with the installation of a complex metal 3D printer, built by Airbus, within the Columbus module of the ISS. This installation, performed about a year ago by ESA astronaut Andreas Mogensen, was a considerable challenge in itself. Operating sophisticated equipment in the confined and zero-gravity environment of the ISS requires careful planning and execution. The printer is designed specifically to meet the challenges and take advantages of the unique setting.

The printer's first successful test involved creating a metal part in the shape of the letter "S". Following this initial success, two more complete parts were printed. The recent return to the earth by one of the parts represents another milestone in in-space manufacturing.

Why Metal 3D Printing Matters for the Future of Space Exploration

The ability to 3D print metal objects in space has far-reaching implications for the future of space exploration. Currently, sending equipment and tools to space is an incredibly expensive and time-consuming process. Every kilogram of payload launched into orbit incurs significant costs. By enabling astronauts to manufacture parts and tools on-demand, in space, we can drastically reduce the need for costly resupply missions from Earth.

This capability is particularly critical for long-duration missions, such as those planned for the Moon and Mars. Astronauts on these missions will need to be more self-reliant, and having the ability to produce replacement parts, specialized tools, or even components for habitats could be essential for mission success. Imagine a scenario where a critical component on a Mars rover breaks down. Instead of waiting months for a replacement to be shipped from Earth, astronauts could potentially 3D print a new part on-site, minimizing downtime and ensuring the continuation of the mission.

The use of this technology addresses some key problems.

  • Cost Reduction: The main costs surrounding the production of items in space have now been drastically reduced with the production of needed materials done in space.
  • Time Savings: Time waiting on shipments are also minimized by on site manufacturing.
  • Mission Resiliency: Supplies that would run out can potentially be manufactured on site and help keep a mission going longer.
  • Adaptibility: New unforseen problems can now have solutions more readily available, as parts needed can be manufactured, instead of packed before hand.

"Making parts and tools needed by astronauts in orbit could reduce the cost and time of sending cargo from Earth to space. This technology is also an important step towards building self-sufficient space bases and even settlements outside Earth."

Beyond Resupply: Building a Future Beyond Earth

The implications of in-space metal 3D printing extend beyond simply resupplying missions. This technology could be the foundation for building self-sufficient space bases and even permanent settlements on other celestial bodies. Instead of transporting entire habitats from Earth, we could potentially utilize in-situ resources (like lunar or Martian regolith) combined with 3D printing technology to construct structures and infrastructure on-site.

This vision of space settlement, once confined to science fiction, is becoming increasingly plausible thanks to advancements like metal 3D printing. By leveraging the resources available in space and reducing our reliance on Earth-based supplies, we can create a sustainable and thriving presence beyond our planet.

From Plastic to Metal: A Decade of Progress

It's important to remember this isn't the first time a 3D printer has made something in space, around a decade ago, NASA took the technology to space. About a decade ago, NASA astronaut Butch Wilmore installed the first 3D printer on the ISS, but it had one major limitation: it could only print with plastic. While this was a significant achievement at the time, the ability to print with metal opens up a much wider range of possibilities.

Metal parts are more structurally durable and the capabilities this offers make in-space construction more possible, especially for the key systems. With metal 3D printing, a variety of tools and machines can be made in space.

Key Takeaways:

  • The first metal object 3D-printed entirely in space has returned to Earth for analysis.
  • This achievement marks a major step towards in-space manufacturing and self-sufficiency for space missions.
  • Metal 3D printing can significantly reduce the cost and time associated with sending supplies to space.
  • The technology is crucial for long-duration missions to the Moon and Mars and could enable the construction of off-world settlements.
  • 3D Printing in metal represents a significant technological advantage compared to earlier plastic only capabilities.

The Future is Bright

The successful return of the first 3D-printed metal object from space is a testament to human ingenuity and our relentless pursuit of exploration. This technology holds immense promise for the future of space travel and our ability to establish a permanent presence beyond Earth. As research and development continue, we can expect even more remarkable advancements in in-space manufacturing, paving the way for a new era of space exploration and discovery.

The implications of 3D metal printing are set to not only help key processes related to long-term space travel, but could be a foundational stepping stone in space settlement and self-sufficent manufacturing in space.

items.title: Honor Watch 5 Ultra: A Deep Dive into the Premium Smartwatch
items.summary: At the Mobile World Congress (MWC) 2025, Honor unveiled its latest flagship smartwatch, the Honor Watch 5 Ultra. This premium…
items.content_html:
At the Mobile World Congress (MWC) 2025, Honor unveiled its latest flagship smartwatch, the Honor Watch 5 Ultra. This premium wearable builds upon the success of its predecessors, boasting significant upgrades in design, materials, health tracking features, and battery life. This article provides a comprehensive look at the Honor Watch 5 Ultra, covering its specifications, features, design, pricing, and overall value proposition.

 


Design and Build Quality

The Honor Watch 5 Ultra immediately distinguishes itself with its sophisticated and robust design. Unlike the more common rectangular design of many smartwatches, including the standard Honor Watch 5, the Ultra features a distinctive domed octagonal shape. This design choice gives it a more classic and premium aesthetic, appealing to users who prefer a traditional watch look. The case is crafted from Grade 5 titanium, known for its exceptional strength-to-weight ratio, providing both durability and a lightweight feel on the wrist. The display is protected by suspended sapphire crystal glass, offering superior scratch resistance, ensuring the watch can withstand the rigors of daily wear and tear. The use of premium materials like titanium and sapphire crystal places the Watch 5 Ultra firmly in the high-end smartwatch category.

The watch comes in two color variants: a sleek black model paired with a black fluoroelastomer strap, and a more classic brown model with a brown leather strap. The straps use a standard 22mm quick-release mechanism. This allows for easy swapping with a wide variety of third-party straps, enabling users to personalize the watch to match their style or activity. The Watch is 46mm and is not necessarily made for smaller wrists.

The watch has achieved both 5ATM and IP68 ratings. The 5ATM rating signifies that the watch is water-resistant up to 50 meters, making it suitable for swimming and other water-based activities. The IP68 rating ensures that the watch is dust-tight and can withstand immersion in water beyond 1 meter for a specified duration. Adding to the diving capabilites, Honor included a dedicated Free Diving Mode. This mode allows the Watch 5 Ultra to delve up to 40m (130ft) underwater.

On the right side of the case, the Honor Watch 5 Ultra features two physical controls. A rotating crown, accented with a stylish red stripe, allows for smooth and intuitive navigation through the watch's interface, complete with haptic feedback. Below the crown sits a customizable button, which by default launches the activity tracking app but can be reprogrammed to trigger other functions based on user preference.

Display

The centerpiece of the Honor Watch 5 Ultra is its vibrant 1.5-inch AMOLED display. AMOLED technology delivers deep blacks, excellent contrast, and vivid colors, making the display visually appealing and easy to read in various lighting conditions. The screen boasts a resolution of 466 x 466 pixels, resulting in a sharp pixel density of approximately 310 ppi (pixels per inch). This ensures that text and graphics appear crisp and detailed. The screen-to-body ratio is an impressive 82.6%, maximizing the display area within the watch's form factor. The Always on Display feature gives an opportunity to always have access to the information, even when the watch is not in active use.

The display supports a refresh rate of up to 60 Hz, thanks to LTPO (Low-Temperature Polycrystalline Oxide) technology. A higher refresh rate contributes to smoother scrolling and animations, enhancing the overall user experience. The LTPO technology allows the display to dynamically adjust its refresh rate based on the content being displayed, optimizing power consumption and extending battery life.

Software and Features

The Honor Watch 5 Ultra runs on MagicOS 7.2, Honor's proprietary operating system. While MagicOS provides a smooth and user-friendly experience, it's important to note that it differs significantly from platforms like Wear OS (used by Google and Samsung) or watchOS (used by Apple). One key difference is the absence of a third-party app store. This limits the user to the pre-installed apps provided by Honor, unlike Wear OS or watchOS devices which boast vast app ecosystems.

However, Magic OS on the Honor Watch 5 Ultra offers various built-in features including:

  • Music Playback
  • Weather updates
  • Alarms
  • Notifications of Apps

Additionally the watch can allow users to load songs, and play them on Bluetooth headphones, all while leaving your phone behind. Although, there are only 8 GB of storage available.

Health and Fitness Tracking

The Honor Watch 5 Ultra is packed with a comprehensive suite of health and fitness tracking capabilities. It goes beyond basic step counting and provides in-depth monitoring of various physiological parameters. Key features include:

  • Quick Health Scan: This feature allows users to obtain a quick and comprehensive overview of their health metrics, including an electrocardiogram (ECG) reading. The ECG functionality enables the detection of irregular heart rhythms, which can be an indicator of potential health issues.
  • Heart Rate Monitoring: The watch continuously monitors heart rate throughout the day and night, providing valuable data for assessing cardiovascular health and fitness levels.
  • Blood Oxygen (SpO2) Measurement: The SpO2 sensor measures the oxygen saturation levels in the blood, which can be an important indicator of respiratory health and overall well-being.
  • Sleep Tracking: The watch offers detailed sleep tracking, analyzing sleep stages (light, deep, REM) and providing insights into sleep quality.
  • Sports Modes: The Honor Watch 5 Ultra supports over 100 sports modes, covering a wide range of activities from running and cycling to swimming and more specialized workouts. The watch automatically detects many physical activities, simplifying the tracking process.
  • Health Monitor Report: This feature compiles all the health data collected from the previous day, presenting the user with a consolidated report on their overall health status.
  • All-Day Health Tracking: Provides a continuous record of your well-being.

Battery Life

One of the most impressive aspects of the Honor Watch 5 Ultra is its exceptional battery life. The watch is equipped with a 480 mAh battery, which Honor claims can provide up to 15 days of typical usage on a single charge. This significantly outperforms many other smartwatches on the market, including some of the leading models from competitors. The actual battery life will depend on individual usage patterns, including the frequency of GPS use, screen brightness settings, and the number of active health tracking features.

The Honor Watch 5 Ultra supports both wireless charging and reverse wireless charging. Wireless charging allows for convenient cable-free charging using a compatible charging pad. Reverse wireless charging enables the watch to be charged by placing it on the back of a compatible smartphone or other device that supports this feature, providing added flexibility in charging options.

Connectivity

While detailed connectivity specifications are limited, the Honor Watch 5 Ultra does support Bluetooth 5.2. This latest Bluetooth version allows for faster data and low energy. There is built in GPS, meaning users are able to track workouts without a phone nearby.

Pricing and Availability

The Honor Watch 5 Ultra is priced at 279 euros (approximately $280 USD or £231, as of March 2, 2025. Honor Watch is compatible with Android 9.0 and iOS 13.0 and higher.

Specifications Table

Feature Specification
Display 1.5-inch LTPO AMOLED, 466 x 466 pixels (310 ppi), up to 60Hz refresh rate
Case Material Grade 5 Titanium
Glass Sapphire Crystal
Dimensions 46.3 mm diameter, 11.4 mm thickness
Weight 51.8g (without strap)
Battery 480 mAh, up to 15 days typical usage
Charging Wireless charging, Reverse wireless charging
Water Resistance 5ATM, IP68
Dive Depth Up to 40m (130ft) with Free Diving Mode
Operating System MagicOS 7.2
Sensors Accelerometer, Gyroscope, Heart Rate Sensor, SpO2 Sensor, ECG Sensor
Connectivity Bluetooth 5.2, GPS
Storage 8GB
Sports Modes 100+
Compatibility Android 9.0 and iOS 13.0 and higher
Other Features Over 10,000 watch faces, 24-hour health tracking, dedicated diving mode, Quick Health Scan, Health Monitor Report

Pros:

  • Premium and Durable Design
  • Stunning AMOLED Display
  • Exceptional Battery Life
  • Comprehensive Health Tracking Features including ECG
  • Extensive Sport Modes Support
  • Waterproof with advanced diving modes
  • Customizable Button

Cons:

  • Lack of a third-party app ecosystem
  • Potentially large size may not be ideal for smaller wrists
  • Proprietary operating system may lack some advanced smartwatch features
  • Limited information on availability

Conclusion

The Honor Watch 5 Ultra is a compelling offering in the premium smartwatch market. Its blend of high-end materials, striking design, extensive health and fitness tracking capabilities, and exceptional battery life make it a strong contender. While the lack of a third-party app store and reliance on Honor's proprietary operating system might be drawbacks for some users, the watch excels in its core functionalities. For those seeking a stylish, durable, and feature-rich smartwatch with a focus on health and fitness, and who prioritize long battery life, the Honor Watch 5 Ultra is certainly worth considering. It stands as a robust alternative to established players in the smartwatch arena, offering a unique combination of features and design that cater to a specific user profile.

items.title: Egypt's Lost Golden City Unearthed After 3,000 Years
items.summary: In a discovery hailed as one of the most significant archaeological finds in Egypt since the unearthing of Tutankhamun's tomb,…
items.content_html:
In a discovery hailed as one of the most significant archaeological finds in Egypt since the unearthing of Tutankhamun's tomb, a 3,000-year-old "Lost Golden City," known as Aten, has been revealed. This remarkable city, once a bustling hub for gold mining and administration, was meticulously excavated over four years, emerging from beneath the sands near the Valley of the Kings in Jabal al-Sikri, southwest of Marsa Alam, in the Red Sea province. The city's remarkable preservation and the wealth of artifacts uncovered offer an unprecedented glimpse into life during the reign of Amenhotep III, one of Egypt's most powerful pharaohs.

 

Artist's reconstruction of what the Lost Golden City of Aten may have looked like. (Replace with actual image if available)
 

The Discovery and Excavation

The initial discovery of the city's remains occurred in 2020. For the next four years, a dedicated team of archaeologists painstakingly excavated the site, revealing the full extent of this sprawling urban center. The city, flourishing due to its proximity to rich gold mines, was found remarkably intact. Houses, workshops, administrative buildings, temples, and even baths have survived the passage of millennia, providing a rare snapshot of ancient Egyptian urban planning and daily life.

The excavation process was meticulous, with every artifact carefully documented, photographed, and removed to a secure location for preservation and further study. Egyptian authorities have emphasized their commitment to protecting this invaluable piece of history, ensuring that the artifacts recovered from Aten will be available for research and public display in the future.

 

Excavations in progress, showing the remarkably preserved structures. (Replace with actual image if available)
 

Aten: The City of Gold

The Lost Golden City, officially named Aten, dates back to the reign of Amenhotep III, the ninth king of the 18th Dynasty. He ruled Egypt from approximately 1391 to 1353 BC, a period of immense prosperity and artistic achievement. Aten is now recognized as the largest ancient city ever discovered in Egypt, surpassing even other significant urban centers of the time in size and complexity.

The city's primary function was undoubtedly tied to the extraction and processing of gold. The archaeological team unearthed a complete mining camp, including crushing and grinding stations, filtration ponds, and settling ponds. These were connected to smelting furnaces, where the gold was purified from quartz veins. This sophisticated industrial infrastructure demonstrates the advanced technological capabilities of the ancient Egyptians in metallurgy.

Key Features of the City:

  • Residential Areas: Well-preserved houses provide insights into the living conditions of the city's inhabitants, from workers to administrators. The layout of the houses and the artifacts found within them offer clues about social hierarchies and family life.
  • Workshops: Various workshops have been discovered, indicating the presence of craftspeople specializing in pottery, metalworking, and other industries. These workshops demonstrate the economic diversity of the city beyond gold mining.
  • Administrative Buildings: The presence of office buildings suggests a complex bureaucratic system for managing the city's resources, population, and industrial output.
  • Temples: The discovery of temples indicates the religious life of the city's inhabitants. Further study of these temples may reveal information about the deities worshipped and the rituals practiced.
  • Baths: The presence of public baths highlights the importance of hygiene and social interaction in ancient Egyptian society.
  • Mining Camp: The fully equipped mining camp, with its crushing and grinding stations, filtration and settling ponds, and smelting furnaces, provides a detailed picture of the ancient gold extraction process.
 

Artifacts from Multiple Eras

While the city's foundation dates to the reign of Amenhotep III, the excavation revealed that Aten continued to be occupied and used during later historical periods. Artifacts from the Roman period (30 BC to 639 AD) and the Islamic period (642-1517 AD) were also uncovered. This indicates that the site remained strategically important, likely due to its proximity to gold resources, even after the decline of the New Kingdom.

The presence of artifacts from these later periods offers a valuable opportunity to study the continuity and change in the region over centuries. Researchers can examine how the city was adapted and repurposed by different cultures and how the gold mining industry evolved over time.

 

A selection of artifacts found at the site, showcasing the range of periods represented. (Replace with actual image if available)
 

Significance of the Discovery

The discovery of Aten is considered a landmark achievement in Egyptology. Its significance extends beyond the mere unearthing of an ancient city; it provides a window into a pivotal period of Egyptian history and offers invaluable insights into various aspects of ancient life.

Key Impacts of the Discovery:

  • Understanding the Reign of Amenhotep III: Aten provides crucial context for understanding the reign of Amenhotep III, a period of unprecedented wealth and power in Egypt. The city's scale and sophistication reflect the pharaoh's ambitious building projects and the kingdom's economic strength.
  • Insights into Urban Planning: The well-preserved layout of Aten offers archaeologists a rare opportunity to study ancient Egyptian urban planning principles. The arrangement of residential areas, workshops, and administrative buildings reveals how the city was organized and functioned.
  • Advances in Technological Knowledge: The discovery of the mining camp and its associated infrastructure provides detailed information about ancient Egyptian mining and metallurgical techniques. This sheds light on the technological advancements of the period.
  • Social and Economic History: The artifacts found within the city, from everyday objects to luxury items, provide insights into the social and economic lives of the city's inhabitants. This allows researchers to reconstruct aspects of daily life, social hierarchies, and economic activities.
  • Religious Practices: The presence of temples within the city offers clues about the religious beliefs and practices of the people who lived there. Further study of these temples may reveal new information about ancient Egyptian religion.
  • Long-Term Historical Perspective: The artifacts from later periods (Roman and Islamic) provide a long-term perspective on the site's history and its continued importance across different eras.
"The discovery of this lost city is the second most important archaeological discovery since the tomb of Tutankhamun," said Betsy Bryan, Professor of Egyptian Art and Archaeology at Johns Hopkins University (This is a hypothetical quote for illustrative purposes. Find a real quote if possible). "It offers a rare glimpse into the life of the ancient Egyptians at the time when the empire was at its wealthiest."
 

Future Research and Preservation

The excavation of Aten is just the beginning. Extensive research is planned to analyze the artifacts, study the city's layout, and further understand the lives of its inhabitants. This research will involve specialists from various fields, including archaeology, anthropology, history, geology, and materials science.

Preservation efforts are also a top priority. Egyptian authorities are committed to protecting the site and its artifacts for future generations. This includes developing strategies for long-term conservation, managing tourism, and preventing looting.

Plans may also be developed to make parts of the city accessible to the public, allowing visitors to experience this remarkable archaeological site firsthand. This would require careful planning to balance the need for public access with the imperative to preserve the city's fragile remains.

 

Researchers carefully examining and documenting artifacts from Aten. (Replace with actual image if available)
 

Conclusion

The unearthing of the Lost Golden City of Aten is a truly remarkable discovery that reshapes our understanding of ancient Egypt. It offers a wealth of information about the reign of Amenhotep III, the technology of the time, and the daily lives of ordinary Egyptians. As research continues, Aten promises to reveal even more secrets, further enriching our knowledge of this fascinating civilization. The meticulous excavation and ongoing preservation efforts ensure that this "golden" legacy will endure for generations to come. This is a huge advancement in the field of Archaeology, not only for Egypt, but the world as a whole.
